body.p:
Perform the following steps to reconfigure the ceph services.Configuration changes in ceph.conf
Login to the deployer node
Configure the parameters available in the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/ceph/settings.yml file.
Any additional configuration parameters for Ceph (beyond those listed in the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/ceph/settings.yml file) can be specified in the same file under the 'extra:' category as follows:extra: osd: journal max write entries: 200
Above block configures the OSDs to write a maximum of 200 entries to the journal at any one time.
NOTE: The Ceph log parameter 'debug auth' configures the verbosity of the authentication related logs, which is default configured to level of '1/5'. It is a security risk and therefore highly recommended to not have the 'debug auth' logging verbosely, as, the module will start logging the Ceph user secret's, which will be available to users via the centralized logs. Making Ceph cluster vulnerable.
Run the plays to reconfigure the Ceph services as follows:$cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible $ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-reconfigure.yml
